attributes.action: Stop the covid act being put through without a thorough re look at factual data
attributes.additional_details: The law of the land is being broken and men and women and children will suffer under this act.without unnecessary cause
attributes.background: Act within the law and uphold the English constitution

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure what legislation you're concerned about, or what you want the UK Government or Parliament to do, or not do.

The Coronavirus Act was enacted in 2020, and continues to apply.  The Act requires a Parliamentary review of the temporary provisions of the Act every six months, and most of the provisions of the Act will expire in March 2022. You can find out more about the time limits and post-legislative review of this Act here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus-bill-amended-time-limits-and-post-legislative-review/

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
